etymology.description: 星(星) (xīng, "star") + 期(期) (qī, "period; time") + 六(六) (liù, "six") combine to denote the sixth day of the week, Saturday. The naming convention for days of the week in Chinese is based on a numerical sequence starting from Sunday.
etymology.interpretation: 星期六(xīngqīliù, "Saturday") follows the sequential naming pattern used for days of the week in Chinese, with 六 (liù, "six") indicating it is the sixth day.

examples.chinese: 星期六(星期六)，我不上班(我不上班)。
星期六(星期六)，我和朋友一起去郊游(我和朋友一起去郊遊)。
examples.pinyin: Xīngqīliù, wǒ hé péngyǒu yīqǐ qù jiāoyóu.
examples.english: On Saturday, I go for a picnic with my friends.

examples.chinese: 星期六(星期六)，我喜欢睡到自然醒(我喜歡睡到自然醒)。
examples.pinyin: Xīngqīliù, wǒ xǐhuān shuì dào zìrán xǐng.
examples.english: On Saturday, I like to sleep in.
